definition: seat of government/government repository (archive)/official residence/mansion/presidential palace/(honorific) Your home/prefecture (from Tang to Qing times)
open and candid (idiom); not hiding anything/ingenuous
subtle way of thinking (idiom); hard to fathom/deep and shrewd

sentences.english: Flooding forced the closure of manufacturing plants in Ayutthaya, according to news reports.
sentences.chinese: 據新聞報道，洪水已迫使大城府的製造工廠關閉。

sentences.english: Yang Hu of the Meng Sun family had huge ambitions and in-depth deliberations.
sentences.chinese: 孟孫家有個陽虎，野心很大，城府又深。

sentences.english: The temple is part of Ayutthaya Historical Park.
sentences.chinese: 目前該寺已成爲大城府歷史公園的一部分。

sentences.english: The concept of the pool villas is based on Ayutthaya architecture.
sentences.chinese: 的概念，游泳池的別墅是基於大城府建築。

sentences.english: The reality is naive murderer, Ayutthaya you no one guessed through.
sentences.chinese: 現實是天真的兇手，你的城府沒人猜的透。

definition: rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
subtle way of thinking (idiom); hard to fathom/deep and shrewd
variant of 老奸巨猾[lao3 jian1 ju4 hua2]
open and candid (idiom); not hiding anything/ingenuous
experienced in the ways of the world (idiom); worldly-wise/sophisticated
lit. deep plans and distant thoughts/to plan far ahead (idiom)
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
